intro: Heracleum sphondylium var. turugisanense, commonly known as the Turkestan cowparn. This variant is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. The plant is native to Central Asia and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
